## Z scores

```{r}
x_vec = rnorm(25, mean = 5, sd = 4)

(x_vec - mean(x_vec)) / sd(x_vec)

z_scores = function(x) {
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(x = x_vec)

y_vec = rnorm(40, 12, .3)

z_scores(y_vec)
```


```{r, error = TRUE}
z_scores = function(x) {
  
  if(!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if(length(x) < 3) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 numbers")
  }
  
  z = (x - mean(x)) / sd(x)
  
  return(z)
  
}

z_scores(3)

z_scores("Roxy")

z_scores(y_vec)
```

```{r}
mean_and_sd = function(x) {
  
  if (!is.numeric(x)) {
    stop("x needs to be numeric")
  }
  
  if (length(x) < 3) {
    stop("x should have at least 3 numbers")
  }
  
  mean_x = mean(x)
  sd_x = sd(x)
  
  output_df = 
    tibble(
      mean = mean_x,
      sd = sd_x
    )
  
  return(output_df)
}

mean_and_sd(x_vec)
mean_and_sd(y_vec)
```


## Different sample siezs, means, sds

```{r}
sim_data = 
  tibble(
    x = rnorm(30, mean = 2, sd = 3)
  )

sim_data %>% 
  summarize(
    mean = mean(x),
    sd = sd(x)
  )
```

Let's write function that simulates data, compute mean and sd.

```{r}
sim_mean_sd = function(n, mu, sigma) {
  
    sim_data = 
    tibble(
      x = rnorm(n, mean = mu, sd = sigma)
    )
  
  sim_data %>% 
    summarize(
      mean = mean(x),
      sd = sd(x)
    )
  
}

sim_mean_sd(30, 4, 3)
```
